title: Birth rate in Italy 2018 , by region
summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Birth rate per thousand inhabitants in each Month on the y axis.
Month Trentino-South Tyrol has the highest Birth rate per thousand inhabitants and Sardinia has the lowest Birth rate per thousand inhabitants.
The highest Month Trentino-South Tyrol has 3.3 more Birth rate per thousand inhabitants than the lowest Month Sardinia.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Birth rate per thousand inhabitants for 20 number of Months.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is appeared to be the highest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and lowest at Month Sardinia.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Birth rate per thousand inhabitants in each Month on the y axis.
Month Trentino-South Tyrol has the highest Birth rate per thousand inhabitants and Sardinia has the lowest Birth rate per thousand inhabitants.
The highest Month Trentino-South Tyrol has 3.3 more Birth rate per thousand inhabitants than the lowest Month Sardinia.
max_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Birth rate per thousand inhabitants in each Month on the y axis.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is highest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and lowest at Month Sardinia.
The highest Month Trentino-South Tyrol has 3.3 more Birth rate per thousand inhabitants than the lowest Month Sardinia.
Birth rate per thousand inhabitants at Month Trentino-South Tyrol is 9.0 , second place is Campania at 8.3, and thirdly is Sicily at 8.1.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants has decreased over the past 20 Months.
Month Lazio, Apulia, Aosta Valley, and Veneto have the same Birth rate per thousand inhabitants.
The lowest value 5.7 at Sardinia is almost 1.28 times smaller than the average value 7.05.
